Key Match Events: Gui Santos nailed a corner 3 to tie the score within 18 seconds of entering the game
Santos had a slick assist to Trayce Jackson-Davis a couple of minutes later
Santos made four of his six 3s in the win
Lindy Waters III went 3-of-7, and Buddy Hield hit five of his 11 from deep, carrying the offense enough on a night when Steph Curry didn’t have it
Santos made a game-changing play in the third quarter by tipping the ball away from Isaiah Stewart
Santos outmaneuvered Simone Fontecchio and Tobias Harris, tipping it away from both and then chasing it down
Pre-Game Insights: Warriors coach Steve Kerr put Gui Santos into the game at the 3:54 mark of the first quarter with the Warriors trailing 17-14
Kerr emphasized the importance of hustle and winning little battles in the game
Santos has worked tirelessly on his 3-point shot the last few seasons in the Warriors’ program
Post-Match Reflections: Warriors coach Steve Kerr praised Gui Santos for his hustle and winning little battles in the game
Santos will likely get another rotation chance at the Indianapolis Pacers on Friday night with the Warriors’ lineup still depleted
Kerr highlighted that the game is about more than just shooting, but also defense, rebounding, and hustle
Miscellaneous Highlights: Steph Curry didn’t have a good game, finishing 5-of-21 overall and 2-of-14 on 3s
Buddy Hield badly needed a breakout night and hit five of his 11 from deep
The Warriors’ lineup was depleted, with several players sidelined due to injuries and personal matters
